meanings.definition: Stylish or fashionable in a pretentious or excessive way.
meanings.sent1: She wore a chichier dress to the party, standing out with its flashy design.
meanings.sent2: The boutique displayed chichier clothes that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: His chichier hat made him look like a walking fashion show.
meanings.sent4: The chichier decorations at the event transformed the venue into a glamorous paradise.
meanings.sent5: The chichier jewelry sparkled under the bright lights, drawing admiring glances.

meanings.definition: Someone who is overly concerned with being fashionable or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the chichier of the group, always following the latest trends.
meanings.sent2: The chichier in the office always had the most eye-catching outfits.
meanings.sent3: The chichier's closet was overflowing with designer labels and accessories.
meanings.sent4: Being a chichier meant constantly seeking validation through appearance.
meanings.sent5: The chichier's Instagram was filled with selfies showcasing their fashion sense.

meanings.definition: To make something more elaborate or showy in a way that is considered excessive or pretentious.
meanings.sent1: She decided to chichier up the room by adding glitter to the decorations.
meanings.sent2: The designer chichiered the dress with sequins and feathers for the runway show.
meanings.sent3: He always chichiered up his stories to make them more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The chef chichiered the dessert with edible gold leaf for a touch of luxury.
meanings.sent5: The artist chichiered the painting by adding intricate details to every corner.
